title: Rentrak Corp. Earnings Q1, 2015
text:
Search Rentrak Corp. Earnings Q1, 2015 Posted by CapitalCube on September 1, 2015 in Earnings Analysis , Yahoo Finance | 126 Views | Leave a response 
Rentrak Corp. reports preliminary financial results for the quarter ended June 30, 2015. 
We analyze the earnings along side the following peers of Rentrak Corporation – Gartner, Inc., Lions Gate Entertainment Corp., AMC Networks Inc. Class A, Cinedigm Corp, comScore, Inc., Madison Square Garden Company Class A and Technicolor SA Sponsored ADR (IT-US, LGF-US, AMCX-US, CIDM-US, SCOR-US, MSG-US and TCLRY-US) that have also reported for this period. Highlights Summary numbers: Revenues of USD 27.53 million, Net Earnings of USD 1.57 million, and Earnings per Share (EPS) of USD 0.10. Gross margins narrowed from 62.51% to 60.25% compared to the same quarter last year, operating (EBITDA) margins now 29.11% from 3.57%. Year-on-year change in operating cash flow of -402.81% is about the same as the change in earnings, likely no significant movement in accruals or reserves. Earnings growth from operating margin improvements as well as one-time items. 
The table below shows the preliminary results and recent trends for key metrics such as revenues and net income growth: 2014-06-30 Click here to view Market Share Versus Profits 
RENT-US ‘s change in revenue this quarter compared to the same quarter last year of 23.21% is almost the same as its change in earnings, and is about average among the announced results thus far in its peer group, suggesting that RENT-US is holding onto its market share. Also, for comparison purposes, revenues changed by -3.28% and earnings by 399.24% compared to the immediate last quarter. Earnings Growth Analysis 
The company’s gross margins showed no year-on-year improvement. In spite of this, the company’s earnings rose, influenced primarily by the improvement in operating margins (EBITDA margins) from 3.57% to 29.11%. For comparison, gross margins were 58.73% and EBITDA margins were 13.01% in the last period. Gross Margin Trend 
Companies sometimes sacrifice improvements in revenues and margins in order to extend friendlier terms to customers and vendors. Capital Cube probes for such activity by comparing the changes in gross margins with any changes in working capital. If the gross margins improved without a worsening of working capital, it is possible that the company’s performance is a result of truly delivering in the marketplace and not simply an accounting prop-up using the balance sheet. 
RENT-US ‘s decline in gross margins has not produced any significant offsetting improvement in its working capital . This leads Capital Cube to conclude that the decline in gross margins are likely from operating issues and not trade-offs with the balance sheet. Working capital days are currently 256.63 days, compared to last year’s level of 88.07 days. Cash Versus Earnings – Sustainable Performance? 
RENT-US ‘s change in operating cash flow of -402.81% compared to the same period last year is about the same as its change in earnings this period. Additionally, this change in operating cash flow is about average among its peer group. This suggests that the company did not use accruals or reserves to manage earnings this period, and that, all else being equal, the earnings number is sustainable. Margins 
The company’s earnings growth has also been influenced by the following factors: (1) Improvements in operating (EBIT) margins from -3.84% to 20.69% and (2) one-time items. The company’s pretax margins are now 7.80% compared to -5.99% for the same period last year. 
Access our Ratings and Scores for Rentrak Corp. Click here to view Company Profile 
Rentrak Corp. engages in the business of providing transactional media measurement and analytical services to the entertainment and media industries. It operates through the Advanced Media and Information and Home Entertainment operating divisions. The Advanced Media and Information division includes its media measurement services. The Home Entertainment division covered the distributions services as well as services that measure, aggregate, and report consumer rental activity on film product from traditional Âbrick and mortar,Â online and kiosk retailers. The company was founded in 1977 and is headquartered in Portland, OR.
